section.title: DESCRIPTION
section.para: The varnishreplay utility parses Varnish logs and attempts to reproduce the traffic. It is typically used to warm up caches or various forms of testing.

varlistentry.term: -a backend Send the traffic over tcp to this server, specified by an

listitem.para: address and a port. This option is mandatory. Only IPV4 is supported at this time.

varlistentry.term: -r file Parse logs from this file. The input file has to be from

listitem.para: a varnishlog of the same version as the varnishreplay binary. This option is mandatory.

section.title: HISTORY
section.para: The varnishreplay utility and this manual page were written by Cecilie Fritzvold and later updated by Per Buer.
